Summary: Marine layer in bright orange red "fireball" in sky and changes flight pattern
divs: sighting details9:27pst cardiff by the sea, california, marine layer is heavy, i'm taking out trash and am forced to look up and acknowledge a bright glowing red\orange fireball that is far away but i can see it glow beyond the marine layer, it appeared to flicker, travel nw, but appears to travel back south, gets bright then dimmed out to nothing in the sky. i was completely mesmerized by this dance and assumed it was a comet, satellite, or shooting star, so i didn't think to record it on my phone...but when i saw the object, round in nature, change direction, i ran in and got my phone. by this time 2 minutes passed and who knows how long it had been glowing since i first saw it. it appeared to shake back and forth, then loose it's color. i saw it positioned in the west, travel nw, light a slow shooting star, the completely turn direction to south... i texted my neighbor who is an astronomy buff: "is there a comet tonight?" "i just saw a bright orange light in sky that was moving odd ways and it was bright for about 2 minutes then dimmed and now gone!" i never got a text back from him...i don't see any stars and no planes. it looked like someone was flashing their headlight from the sky at me! this was so cool!
